content: ETF Investments AMA The Fifth Person Asked by AnonymousAsked on 16 Feb 2019How do you determine the intrinsic value of an ETF?1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Victor Chng, Co-Founder at Fifth Person Pte LtdLevel 4. ProdigyUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hi,I uses the Bloomberg app to guage the index valuation using PE ratio. In general, the average PE range for all index ETF is around 15x. If the index is trading below 10x then I deemed it as cheap. Few months ago, the Hang Seng index was trading below PE 10x which i think is cheap so I bought some Hang Seng ETF for my wife.3 comments0

See all 3 comments Victor Chng19 Feb 2019Hi Question Poster, I will usually buy index ETF if their PE ratio is below 10xKishor Bhagwat08 Mar 2019I use the CAPE10 as one of the metrics for country/region ETF. But also look at political risk for the country...Russia is really cheap currently but I wouldnt touch it!
